meanings.definition: To move or draw towards the midline of the body.
meanings.sent1: She was adducting her arms during the exercise class.
meanings.sent2: The physical therapist instructed the patient to practice adducting his legs.
meanings.sent3: The dance instructor joked that adducting their hips would make them better dancers.
meanings.sent4: The magnets were adducting towards each other, as if pulled by an invisible force.
meanings.sent5: The teacher demonstrated adducting the ruler to the center of the whiteboard.

meanings.sent1: The team was adducting their ideas to create a winning strategy.
meanings.sent2: The diplomat's goal was to adduct the conflicting parties for peace talks.
meanings.sent3: The chef was adducting various flavors to create a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: The community project was adducting people from different backgrounds to work together.
meanings.sent5: The artist was adducting different colors to form a beautiful painting.
